summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 2019 regarding logistical planning for interviews in the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The New York Field Office requests to have 10 people on standby to assist with interviewing individuals served with subpoenas.

persons.name: M SSA
persons.context: Addressee of the forwarded email, thanked by the sender for assistance.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: Assistant Special Agent in Charge, New York Field Office
persons.context: Sender of the original request for assistance, coordinating standby personnel for interviews related to the Epstein death investigation.

connections.description: Internal FBI colleagues communicating about operational logistics for the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Subpoenas Served in Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: The FBI New York team served 16 subpoenas as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Planned Interview Surge
events.description: Anticipated surge of people needing to be interviewed on Monday and/or Tuesday following the service of subpoenas.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death as of August 2019.
16 subpoenas had been served by the FBI New York team as part of this death investigation.
The investigation anticipated a surge of interviewees, requiring 10 FBI personnel to be on standby.
The email indicates coordinated, large-scale investigative activity shortly after Epstein's death.
